text: Dude. I love living in France, but I can't even imagine having to work in a normal French workplace, let alone a tech startup
author: BerinSzoka

text:
Le trente-cinq (35 hour work week)
5-7 weeks of vacation 
The impossibility of firing anyone
Frankly, the general quality of life and thus the higher opportunity cost of working like a dog
The STRONG bias against the untried and novel
The pervasive stasis mentality
author: BerinSzoka

text:
The overcooked beef and potatoes crowd feels threatened by people with decent food

Fuck 'em
author: BerinSzoka

text: By 2000, when I interned for his department at Cato, it was already apparent to me, as a 19 year-old, that Steve was a total hack

text: OK, finally, we can all stop listening to her music and watching her films. Right?

Even from prison...

author: BerinSzoka

text:
Fuck you, Blake

Now, please tell me what the legal effect of this bill would be. Or how you can "codify #NetNeutrality" while adding ZERO words to the United States Code?
author: BerinSzoka

text:
MUELLER REPORT HAS BEEN SUBMITTED TO CONGRESS

Over/Under on how long it'll take to go public?
author: BerinSzoka

text: The #SaveTheInternet act bill is a total fake and you know it
author: BerinSzoka

text:
EXCEPT IT'S TOTAL BULLSHIT

And if you don't understand why, go to law school and then we'll talk
author: BerinSzoka

text:
Democrats haven't offered a single. substantive counter proposal since 2012

Neither CRA and the Save the Internet Act could actually have "preserved" net neutrality or effected the classification of broadband under Title II
author: BerinSzoka

text:
Well, more important than the number was the complete absence of anyone who's been crying panic about net neutrality, other than those who were on panels

The Chicken Littles just didn't bother to show up
author: BerinSzoka

text: tl;dr: Um, sorry, we totally thought Iraq was worth invading because they were buying ALUMINUM TUBES. So sue us!
author: BerinSzoka

text:
"But, Michelle, the 2015 Open Internet Order was based on a factual record"
- Jonathan Sallet

 "I would argue that the Order was NOT based on a factual record. I've read it many times but couldn't find one!"
- Michelle Connolly



#FTChearings #netneutrality
author: BerinSzoka

text:
Ugh, now we're talking about Aspen Skiing and whether ISPs can be said to be in control of an "essential facility"

AND once we hit 5pm, they turned off the HVAC, so it's starting to get really hot in here

Not sure which is worse

#FTChearings #NetNeutrality
author: BerinSzoka

text:
I count 45 people still in the room, including FTC staff and panelists (but not security guards or AV staff)

So, yeah, it turns out people don't really care all that much about protecting #NetNeutrality after all
author: BerinSzoka

text:
The most dangerous phrase I'm familiar with in rulemaking or legislation is "We need to make sure this never happens again." Because ... we should focus on harmful conduct
- Bill Blumenthal

#FTChearings #NetNeutrality
author: BerinSzoka

text:
If you are referring to the #SaveTheInternt Act, could you please explain to me how a bill that puts ZERO words into the U.S. Code can "restore #netneutrality?

Did you read our critique of the bill?
https://techpolicycorner.org/the-latest-net-neutrality-fraud-54ff445a35d8 …

It's a total fraud
author: BerinSzoka

text: Kinda busy but...
author: BerinSzoka

text:
Yes, it is still in effect

The RIFO added the last sentence to (a) and added (b) (since the definition of BIAS was deleted). See p 197 of the RIFO.

So, if anything, the rule has been strengthened
author: BerinSzoka

text:
Tune in now to watch us discuss how the #FTC will police #NetNeutrality concerns

Livestream here: https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/events-calendar/ftc-hearing-10-competition-consumer-protection-21st-century …

#FTChearings
author: BerinSzoka

text:
Oh, you mean the transparency rule that the FCC wrote in 2010, left in touch in 2015, and then expanded slightly in 2017?

That rule?

#FTChearings
author: BerinSzoka

text:
The ISP industry is probably the most heavily scrutinized industry in the country. If there really were a #NetNeutrality problem, activists, academics and reporters would expose it
- Matt Brill

#FTCHearings
author: BerinSzoka

text:
.@joshuastager keeps claiming that ISPs were colluding to hold Netflix and other content providers hostage

But @DanRayburn debunked this claim in 2014

https://www.forbes.com/sites/larrydownes/2014/11/25/how-netflix-poisoned-the-net-neutrality-debate/#316f8a431c4d …

Thanks to @feamster for pushing back

#FTCHearings #NetNeutrality

text:

If the EU hadn't sent David Cameron home empty-handed, "Leave" would probably have lost the campaign
author: BerinSzoka

text:
.@joshuastager: "... all that ended in 2017, when the FCC repealed a set of #NetNeutrality regulations that included transparency"

Um, has he actually read the RIFO? Because it maintained and EXPANDED the 2015 Order's transparency rule



#FTCHearings
author: BerinSzoka

text:
"Jig-a-byte speeds"

Ugh

If there's one thing worse than pronouncing GIF as "jif," it's this

It's "GIG-a-BIT"

#FTCHearings #FTC
author: BerinSzoka

text:
Yeah, that's how FTC workshops work: outside people come to tell the agency it should use its authority, what the market looks like, etc

Then the agency writes a report, which will guide enforcement
author: BerinSzoka

text:
This is exactly the problem

Your feelings about which agency is the right agency are irrelevant

The reality is that the FTC IS the cop on the beat, and will be until a Democratic FCC re-applies Title II

If you care what happens in the interim, you should be watching

If not...
author: BerinSzoka

text:
Bullshit

This workshop is about how the FTC will actually police broadband--a topic that has had essentially zero discussion since the FTC's 2007 workshop

Anyone who actually cares about protecting consumers should be watching today

But of course, it's politically dull, so...
author: BerinSzoka

text:
After 15 years of bitter argument about #NetNeutrality, not more than 55 people could be bothered to show up to the #FTC's workshop on how the agency will actually police broadband

Because... for all the angst, this is essentially a fake issue cooked up for political demagoguery
author: BerinSzoka

text:
Ok but is the problem unfair discrimination at Stuyvesant or that children of color aren't being adequately prepared to compete?

The right response will differ radically depending on the answer

The Word Gap literature suggests that disparity in performance starts VERY early
author: BerinSzoka

text:

And secondarily, that re-invocation/shit-together-getting never happens?

With at-large districts and proportional representation, America could become a multi-party, effectively parliamentary system overnight, as I've been saying since 2000
